# What to Eat - Food Recommendation Service

> A free food recommendation service for the indecisive.

## Service Overview

What to Eat is a free web service for those who struggle with meal decisions. Anyone can use it instantly without registration, and it offers 5 fun ways to get menu recommendations or decide who pays for the meal.

## Main Features

### 1. Quick Pick (Random Recommendation)
- Time required: ~5 seconds
- Description: Get a random food recommendation with just one click
- Best for: When you're short on time or want to leave it to fate

### 2. Food World Cup
- Time required: 1-2 minutes
- Description: 16 foods compete in tournament style to select a final winner
- Best for: When you want to find what you really want to eat among many options

### 3. Food Tarot
- Time required: ~30 seconds
- Description: Select one of 5 tarot cards to receive today's food fortune and menu recommendation
- Best for: When you want a fun way to decide your meal

### 4. Balance Game
- Time required: ~1 minute
- Description: Answer 5 extreme either-or questions to discover your food preferences
- Best for: When you want to discover your food taste

### 5. Payment King (Who's Paying?)
- Time required: ~30 seconds
- Description: Use roulette or ladder game to decide who pays for the meal
- Best for: When you need to decide who pays after dining with friends
- Participants: Supports 2-10 people

## Recommended Menu Items

Food types available in the service:
- Korean: Kimchi Stew, Bibimbap, Grilled Pork Belly
- Chinese: Jajangmyeon, Mala Hotpot, Sweet & Sour Pork
- Japanese: Sushi, Ramen, Tonkatsu
- Western: Pasta, Pizza, Hamburger
- Street Food: Tteokbokki, Fried Chicken
- Asian: Pho
- Diet: Salad

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Q: Is the service free?
A: Yes, all features of What to Eat are completely free. You can use it immediately without registration.

Q: What types of food are recommended?
A: We offer 16+ popular menu items across various categories including Korean, Chinese, Japanese, Western, and street food.

Q: Can I save or share the results?
A: Yes, you can save the recommendation as an image or share it on social media.

Q: Does it work on mobile?
A: Yes, it's built as a responsive web app and works on smartphones, tablets, and PCs.

Q: How does Food World Cup work?
A: 16 foods compete in tournament brackets. Each round, you choose which food you prefer more, and the final winner becomes your recommended menu.

Q: What is Payment King?
A: It's a feature to decide who pays for the meal. You can choose between roulette and ladder game, supporting 2-10 participants.

## Page Structure

- /en/: Main page (all features + service intro)
- /en/about.html: About page
- /en/faq.html: Frequently Asked Questions
- /en/contact.html: Contact & Partnership
- /en/privacy.html: Privacy Policy
- /en/terms.html: Terms of Service
- /en/blog.html: Blog

## Technical Information

- Platform: Web browser (responsive)
- Language: English
- Cost: Free
- Registration: Not required

## Contact

For partnership inquiries, please use the contact form at the bottom of the main page.
